briefdescription.para: Buffer refill callback function.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Function to call when the buffer is depleted and needs more data.
The callback should return 0 if successful, otherwise a negative error code.

briefdescription.para: Add a null character to the buffer contents.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Add a null byte but do not change the buffer content lengths. The null is added outside the "official" content length. This is useful when calling mprGetBufStart and using the returned pointer as a "C" string pointer.

briefdescription.para: Adjust the buffer end position.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Adjust the buffer start end position by the specified amount. This is typically used to advance the end position as content is appended to the buffer. Adjusting the start or end position will change the value returned by mprGetBufLength. If using the mprPutBlock or mprPutChar routines, adjusting the end position is done automatically.

parameterdescription.para: Positive or negative count of bytes to adjust the start position.

briefdescription.para: Adjust the buffer start position.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Adjust the buffer start position by the specified amount. This is typically used to advance the start position as content is consumed. Adjusting the start or end position will change the value returned by mprGetBufLength. If using the mprGetBlock or mprGetChar routines, adjusting the start position is done automatically.

parameterdescription.para: Positive or negative count of bytes to adjust the start position.

briefdescription.para: Compact the buffer contents.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Compact the buffer contents by copying the contents down to start the the buffer origin.

briefdescription.para: Create a new buffer.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Create a new buffer. Use mprFree to free the buffer

parameterdescription.para: Any memory context allocated by the MPR
Maximum size the buffer can grow to

simplesect.para: a new buffer

briefdescription.para: Flush the buffer contents.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Discard the buffer contents and reset the start end content pointers.

briefdescription.para: Get a block of data from the buffer.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Get a block of data from the buffer start and advance the start position. If the requested length is greater than the available buffer content, then return whatever data is available.

parameterdescription.para: Destination block for the read data.
Count of bytes to read from the buffer.

simplesect.para: The count of bytes rread into the block or -1 if the buffer is empty.

briefdescription.para: Get a reference to the end of the buffer contents.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Get a pointer to the location immediately after the end of the buffer contents.
Pointer to the end of the buffer data contents. Points to the location one after the last data byte.

briefdescription.para: Get the buffer content length.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Get the length of the buffer contents. This is not the same as the buffer size which may be larger.
The length of the content stored in the buffer.

briefdescription.para: Get the origin of the buffer content storage.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Get a pointer to the start of the buffer content storage. This may not be equal to the start of the buffer content if mprAdjustBufStart has been called. Use mprGetBufSize to determine the length of the buffer content storage array.
A pointer to the buffer content storage.

briefdescription.para: Get the buffer refill procedure.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Return the buffer refill callback function.
The refill call back function if defined.

briefdescription.para: Get the current size of the buffer content storage.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: This returns the size of the memory block allocated for storing the buffer contents.
The size of the buffer content storage.

briefdescription.para: Get the space available to store content.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Get the number of bytes available to store content in the buffer
The number of bytes available

briefdescription.para: Get the start of the buffer contents.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Get a pointer to the start of the buffer contents. Use mprGetBufLength to determine the length of the content. Use mprGetBufEnd to get a pointer to the location after the end of the content.
Pointer to the start of the buffer data contents

briefdescription.para: Get a character from the buffer.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Get the next byte from the buffer start and advance the start position.
The character or -1 if the buffer is empty.

briefdescription.para: Grow the buffer.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Grow the storage allocated for content for the buffer. The new size must be less than the maximum limit specified via mprCreateBuf or mprSetBufSize.

parameterdescription.para: Count of bytes by which to grow the buffer content size.

simplesect.para: Zero if successful and otherwise a negative error code

briefdescription.para: Insert a character into the buffer.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Insert a character into to the buffer prior to the current buffer start point.
Zero if successful and otherwise a negative error code

briefdescription.para: Peek at the last character in the buffer.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Non-destructively return the last character from just prior to the end position in the buffer. The character is returned and the end position is not altered.
Zero if successful and otherwise a negative error code

briefdescription.para: Peek at the next character in the buffer.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Non-destructively return the next character from the start position in the buffer. The character is returned and the start position is not altered.
Zero if successful and otherwise a negative error code

briefdescription.para: Put a block to the buffer.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Append a block of data to the buffer at the end position and increment the end pointer.
Zero if successful and otherwise a negative error code

briefdescription.para: Put a character to the buffer.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Append a character to the buffer at the end position and increment the end pointer.
Zero if successful and otherwise a negative error code

briefdescription.para: Put a formatted string to the buffer.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Format a string and Append to the buffer at the end position and increment the end pointer.

parameterdescription.para: Variable arguments for the format string

simplesect.para: Zero if successful and otherwise a negative error code

briefdescription.para: Put an integer to the buffer.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Append a integer to the buffer at the end position and increment the end pointer.

parameterdescription.para: Integer to append to the buffer

simplesect.para: Zero if successful and otherwise a negative error code

briefdescription.para: Put padding characters to the buffer.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Append padding characters to the buffer at the end position and increment the end pointer.

parameterdescription.para: Count of pad characters to put

simplesect.para: Zero if successful and otherwise a negative error code

briefdescription.para: Put a string to the buffer.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Append a null terminated string to the buffer at the end position and increment the end pointer.
Zero if successful and otherwise a negative error code

briefdescription.para: Put a substring to the buffer.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Append a null terminated substring to the buffer at the end position and increment the end pointer.

parameterdescription.para: Put at most count characters to the buffer

simplesect.para: Zero if successful and otherwise a negative error code

briefdescription.para: Refill the buffer with data.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Refill the buffer by calling the refill procedure specified via mprSetBufRefillProc
Zero if successful and otherwise a negative error code

briefdescription.para: Reset the buffer.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: If the buffer is empty, reset the buffer start and end pointers to the beginning of the buffer.

briefdescription.para: Set the maximum buffer size.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Update the maximum buffer size set when the buffer was created

parameterdescription.para: New maximum size the buffer can grow to

briefdescription.para: Set the buffer refill procedure.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Define a buffer refill procedure. The MprBuf module will not invoke or manage this refill procedure. It is simply stored to allow upper layers to use and provide their own auto-refill mechanism.

briefdescription.para: Set the buffer size.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Set the current buffer content size and maximum size limit. Setting a current size will immediately grow the buffer to be this size. If the size is less than the current buffer size, the requested size will be ignored. ie. this call will not shrink the buffer. Setting a maxSize will define a maximum limit for how big the buffer contents can grow. Set either argument to -1 to be ignored.

parameterdescription.para: Size to immediately make the buffer. If size is less than the current buffer size, it will be ignored. Set to -1 to ignore this parameter.
Maximum size the buffer contents can grow to.

simplesect.para: Zero if successful and otherwise a negative error code

briefdescription.para: Steal the buffer memory from a buffer.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Steal ownership of the buffer memory from the buffer structure. All MPR memory is owned by a memory context and the contents of the buffer is owned by the MprBuf object. Stealing the buffer content memory is useful to preserve the buffer contents after the buffer is freed

parameterdescription.para: Memory context to won the memory for the buffer

simplesect.para: pointer to the buffer contents. Use mprGetBufLength before calling mprStealBuf to determine the resulting size of the contents.

briefdescription.para: Dynamic Buffer Module.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para:
MprBuf is a flexible, dynamic growable buffer structure. It has start and end pointers to the data buffer which act as read/write pointers. Routines are provided to get and put data into and out of the buffer and automatically advance the appropriate start/end pointer. By definition, the buffer is empty when the start pointer == the end pointer. Buffers can be created with a fixed size or can grow dynamically as more data is added to the buffer.
For performance, the specification of MprBuf is deliberately exposed. All members of MprBuf are implicitly public. However, it is still recommended that wherever possible, you use the accessor routines provided.

simplesect.title: API Stability:
simplesect.para: Evolving.

MprBuf, mprCreateBuf, mprSetBufMax, mprStealBuf, mprAdjustBufStart, mprAdjustBufEnd, mprCopyBufDown, mprFlushBuf, mprGetCharFromBuf, mprGetBlockFromBuf, mprGetBufLength, mprGetBufOrigin, mprGetBufSize, mprGetBufEnd, mprGetBufSpace, mprGetGrowBuf, mprGrowBuf, mprInsertCharToBuf, mprLookAtNextCharInBuf, mprLookAtLastCharInBuf, mprPutCharToBuf, mprPutBlockToBuf, mprPutIntToBuf, mprPutStringToBuf, mprPutFmtToBuf, mprRefillBuf, mprResetBufIfEmpty, mprSetBufSize, mprGetBufRefillProc, mprSetBufRefillProc, mprFree, MprBufProc
